meanings.definition: Dawed (verb): past tense of daw - to waste time or be slow
meanings.sent1: Yesterday, he dawed around instead of finishing his homework.
meanings.sent2: She always dawed when it came to making decisions.
meanings.sent3: The turtle dawed along the path, making the rabbit laugh.
meanings.sent4: Time dawed like a lazy river on a hot summer day.
meanings.sent5: The snail dawed its way across the garden, leaving a shiny trail behind.

meanings.definition: Dawed (adjective): characterized by being slow or wasting time
meanings.sent1: The dawed progress of the project frustrated everyone involved.
meanings.sent2: His dawed movements made him the last one to finish the race.
meanings.sent3: The sloth was known for its dawed lifestyle in the jungle.
meanings.sent4: The dawed clock seemed to tick slower than all the others.
meanings.sent5: The dawed snail was in no rush to reach its destination.
